entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Parallel Combination of Inductors (Without Mutual Inductance, With Mutual Inductance) - 高中基本電學：電感器並聯組合(無互感、互感)
entry.content:
Introduction

This article introduces the calculation methods for parallel combinations of inductors, including both cases without mutual inductance and with mutual inductance. It also explains how the direction of mutual inductance (assisting or opposing) affects the total inductance.

引言

本文介紹電感器並聯組合的計算方法，包含無互感與有互感兩種情況，並說明互感方向（互助或互消）對總電感量的影響。

Key Points

  1. Parallel Inductors Without Mutual Inductance:
    The formula is similar to parallel resistors:
    $$L_T = \frac{L_1 \times L_2}{L_1 + L_2}$$
  2. Parallel Inductors With Mutual Inductance:
    Determine if the mutual effect is assisting (same magnetic field direction) or opposing (opposite magnetic field direction).
    The formula is:
    $$L_T = \frac{L_1 L_2 - M^2}{L_1 + L_2 \mp 2M}$$
    Use minus sign (−2M) for assisting mutual inductance (larger total inductance).
    Use plus sign (+2M) for opposing mutual inductance (smaller total inductance).

重點歸納

  1. 無互感並聯電感：
    計算公式與電阻並聯相似：
    $$L_T = \frac{L_1 \times L_2}{L_1 + L_2}$$
  2. 有互感並聯電感：
    需判斷互感是互助（磁場方向相同）或互消（磁場方向相反）。
    公式：
    $$L_T = \frac{L_1 L_2 - M^2}{L_1 + L_2 \mp 2M}$$
    互助取負號（−2M），電感量較大。
    互消取正號（+2M），電感量較小。

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Conductance and Conductance Coefficient - 高中基本電學：電導與電導係數
entry.content:
Introduction

This article introduces the fundamental concepts of conductance and conductance coefficient, including their definitions, mathematical relationships, and the factors that affect conductance in materials.

引言

本文介紹電導與電導係數的基本概念，包括其定義、數學關係以及影響材料電導的因素。

Key Points

  1. Definition of Conductance:
    Conductance describes the ability of a material to allow charged particles to flow, which is the opposite of resistance.
  2. Relationship Between Conductance and Resistance:
    Conductance \( G \) and resistance \( R \) are reciprocals:
    $$ G = \frac{1}{R} $$
    Conductance formula:
    $$ G = \gamma \cdot \frac{A}{L} $$
    Where \( \gamma \) is the conductance coefficient, \( A \) is the cross-sectional area, and \( L \) is the length of the object.
  3. Factors Affecting Conductance:
    Conductance Coefficient (\( \gamma \)): The conductivity of the material.
    Length of the Object (\( L \)): Longer lengths result in lower conductance.
    Cross-sectional Area (\( A \)): Larger areas result in higher conductance.
  4. Percentage Conductance Coefficient:
    Used to compare the conductivity of materials against standard copper.

重點歸納

  1. 電導的定義：
    電導是描述物體允許帶電粒子流動的能力，與電阻相反。
  2. 電導與電阻的關係：
    電導 \( G \) 與電阻 \( R \) 互為倒數：
    $$ G = \frac{1}{R} $$
    電導公式：
    $$ G = \gamma \cdot \frac{A}{L} $$
    其中，\( \gamma \) 是電導係數，\( A \) 是截面積，\( L \) 是物體長度。
  3. 影響電導的因素：
    電導係數（\( \gamma \)）：材質的導電能力。
    物體長度（\( L \)）：長度越長，電導越小。
    截面積（\( A \)）：截面積越大，電導越大。
  4. 百分率電導係數：
    用於比較材料的導電能力，以標準韌銅為基準。

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Inductance and Electromagnetism - Inductors in Series (Without and With Mutual Inductance) - 高中基本電學：電感與電磁_電感量_PART F 電感器串聯組合(無互感、有互感)_陳政旭
entry.content:
Introduction

This article summarizes the calculation of total inductance for inductors in series, both without and with mutual inductance. It explains the difference between series aiding and series opposing, and how to use the dot convention to determine the polarity of coils.

引言

本文整理電感器串聯組合的總電感量計算，包含無互感與有互感的情況，說明串聯互助與互消的差異，以及如何利用打點法則判斷線圈極性。

Key Points

  1. Inductors in Series without Mutual Inductance:
    The total inductance is the sum of the individual inductances:
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2$$
  2. Inductors in Series with Mutual Inductance:
    It is necessary to determine whether the mutual inductance is aiding or opposing.
    Series Aiding (Mutual Inductance Aiding):
    The magnetic fields have the same direction, so the mutual inductance is positive.
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + 2M$$
    Series Opposing (Mutual Inductance Opposing):
    The magnetic fields have opposite directions, so the mutual inductance is negative.
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 - 2M$$
  3. Marking Polarity (N-dot Convention):
    Use dots to indicate the polarity (N-pole direction) of the coils to determine whether the mutual inductance is aiding or opposing.

重點歸納

  1. 無互感串聯電感：
    總電感量為各電感相加：
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2$$
  2. 有互感串聯電感：
    需判斷互助（助磁）或互消（消磁）。
    串聯互助：
    磁場方向相同，互感為正。
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + 2M$$
    串聯互消：
    磁場方向相反，互感為負。
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 - 2M$$
  3. 標示N極方向（打點法則）：
    用點標示線圈N極方向，判斷互助或互消。

entry.content:
Introduction

This article explains how to calculate the total inductance of parallel inductors, both with and without considering mutual inductance. It also discusses the effect of the dot convention on mutual inductance in parallel circuits.

引言

本文說明如何計算並聯電感的總電感量，包含不考慮與考慮互感的情況，並介紹互感方向（打點法則）對並聯電感計算的影響。

Key Points

  1. Parallel Inductance Calculation (Ignoring Mutual Inductance):
    $$L_{total} = \frac{L_1 \times L_2}{L_1 + L_2}$$
    Example: For L1=20mH and L2=30mH, total inductance is 12mH.
  2. Parallel Inductance Calculation (Considering Mutual Inductance):
    $$L_{total} = \frac{L_1 \times L_2 - M^2}{L_1 + L_2 - 2M}$$
    Example: For L1=8H, L2=2H, and M=2H, total inductance is 2H.
  3. Mutual Inductance Direction (Dot Convention):
    The direction of mutual inductance (dot convention) affects the calculation. Head-to-head and tail-to-tail with dots in the same direction is mutual assistance in parallel.

重點歸納

  1. 並聯電感計算（不考慮互感）：
    $$L_{total} = \frac{L_1 \times L_2}{L_1 + L_2}$$
    例：L1=20mH，L2=30mH，總電感為12mH。
  2. 並聯電感計算（考慮互感）：
    $$L_{total} = \frac{L_1 \times L_2 - M^2}{L_1 + L_2 - 2M}$$
    例：L1=8H，L2=2H，M=2H，總電感為2H。
  3. 互感方向（打點法則）：
    互感方向（打點法則）會影響計算，頭接頭尾接尾且打點同向屬於互助並聯。

entry.content:
Introduction

This article explains how to calculate the total inductance of inductors in series, both without and with mutual inductance. It also covers the effect of mutual aiding and opposing (magnetic flux direction) on the total inductance.

引言

本文說明如何計算串聯電感的總電感量，包含不考慮互感與考慮互感的情況，並介紹互助與互消（磁力線方向）對總電感的影響。

Key Points

  1. Series Inductance without Mutual Inductance:
    Total inductance is the sum of each inductance, similar to resistors in series.
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + L_3$$
  2. Series Inductance with Mutual Inductance:
    For three inductors \(L_1, L_2, L_3\) in series with mutual inductances \(M_{12}, M_{23}, M_{31}\):
    Mutual aiding (same magnetic flux direction) uses addition; mutual opposing uses subtraction.
    Total inductance formula:
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + L_3 \pm 2M_{12} \pm 2M_{23} \pm 2M_{31}$$
  3. Example Calculations:
    Without mutual inductance: 12H + 4H + 6H = 22H.
    With mutual inductance: Determine aiding or opposing by magnetic flux direction, then calculate using the formula.

重點歸納

  1. 不考慮互感的串聯電感計算：
    總電感為各電感直接相加，類似電阻串聯計算。
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + L_3$$
  2. 考慮互感的串聯電感計算：
    三個電感 \(L_1, L_2, L_3\) 串聯，考慮互感 \(M_{12}, M_{23}, M_{31}\)。
    互助（磁力線方向相同）取加號，互消（磁力線方向相反）取減號。
    總電感公式：
    $$L_{total} = L_1 + L_2 + L_3 \pm 2M_{12} \pm 2M_{23} \pm 2M_{31}$$
  3. 範例計算：
    不考慮互感：12H + 4H + 6H = 22H。
    考慮互感：根據磁力線方向判斷互助或互消，代入公式計算。

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Parallel Circuits - 高中基本電學：並聯電路
entry.content:
Introduction

This article explores the fundamental concepts of parallel circuits, including their definition, characteristics, and mathematical relationships. Understanding parallel circuits is essential for analyzing complex electrical systems and designing efficient circuits.

引言

本文探討並聯電路的基本概念，包括其定義、特性以及數學關係。理解並聯電路對於分析複雜電氣系統和設計高效電路至關重要。

Key Points

Parallel Circuit Definition and Characteristics

  1. Definition:
    A parallel circuit consists of two or more components, where one end of each component is connected together and the other end is also connected together.
  2. Characteristics:
    Equal Voltage: The voltage across all components is the same.
    Independence: If one component fails, it does not affect the operation of other components.
    Total Resistance: The formula for total resistance \( R_T \) is:
    $$\frac{1}{R_T} = \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \cdots + \frac{1}{R_n}$$
    Conductance: The total conductance \( G_T \) is the sum of the conductances of each branch.

重點歸納

並聯電路定義及特性

  1. 定義：
    並聯電路由兩個或以上元件組成，所有元件的一端相連，另一端也相連。
  2. 特性：
    電壓相等：所有元件的電壓相同。
    獨立性：某一元件斷路不影響其他元件的運作。
    總電阻：總電阻 \( R_T \) 計算公式為：
    $$\frac{1}{R_T} = \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \cdots + \frac{1}{R_n}$$
    電導：總電導 \( G_T \) 為各支路電導之和。

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Fundamental Theories of Electricity - Power Part A - 高中基本電學：電學基礎理論 - 電功率 PART A
entry.content:
Title & Introduction Outline

Title: High School Basic Electricity: Basic Theory of Electricity - Power Part A: Power, Horsepower, Electric Power, Examples

  • Power
  • Horsepower
  • Electric Power
  • Examples

標題與前言大綱

標題：高中基本電學_電學基礎理論_電功率_PART A 功率、馬力、電功率、範例

  • 功率
  • 馬力
  • 電功率
  • 範例

Key Points

  1. Power
    Definition: The work done or energy used per unit time.
    Formula: $P = \frac{W}{t}$
    Unit: Watt (W)
  2. Horsepower
    Definition: The power required to lift a 76 kg weight by 1 meter in 1 second.
    Unit: Horsepower (hp)
    Conversion: 1 hp = 746 W
  3. Electric Power
    Definition: The product of voltage and current in a circuit.
    Formula: $P = VI$
    Unit: Watt (W)
  4. Examples
    • Example 1: A lamp has a potential difference of 12 V and a current of 5 A. What is the power consumed?
      $P = VI = 12 \times 5 = 60\,W$
    • Example 2: A prime mover lifts a 1000 N weight by 20 m in 4 seconds. What is the output power and its horsepower?
      Work $W = FS = 1000 \times 20 = 20,000\,J$
      Power $P = \frac{W}{t} = \frac{20,000}{4} = 5,000\,W = 5\,kW$
      Horsepower $= \frac{5,000}{746} \approx 6.7\,hp$

Vocabulary

  • Power
  • Horsepower
  • Electric Power
  • Watt

詳細重點統整

  1. 功率
    定義：單位時間內所做的功或能量。
    公式：$P = \frac{W}{t}$
    單位：瓦特 (Watt, W)
  2. 馬力
    定義：一匹馬在1秒鐘內將76公斤的重物提高1公尺。
    單位：馬力 (Horsepower, hp)
    換算：1 hp = 746 W
  3. 電功率
    定義：電路中電壓和電流的乘積。
    公式：$P = VI$
    單位：瓦特 (Watt, W)
  4. 範例
    • 範例一：電燈兩端的電位差12伏特，流過電燈的電流5安培，消耗功率多少瓦特？
      $P = VI = 12 \times 5 = 60\,W$
    • 範例二：有一個原動機在4秒鐘將1000牛頓的重物提高20公尺，輸出功率多少瓦還有它的馬力是多少？
      做功 $W = FS = 1000 \times 20 = 20,000\,J$
      功率 $P = \frac{W}{t} = \frac{20,000}{4} = 5,000\,W = 5\,kW$
      馬力 $= \frac{5,000}{746} \approx 6.7\,hp$

英文翻譯

  • 功率: Power
  • 馬力: Horsepower
  • 電功率: Electric Power
  • 瓦特: Watt

Reference

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Fundamental Theories of Electricity - Power Part B - 高中基本電學：電學基礎理論 - 電功率 PART B
entry.content:
Introduction

This lesson, taught by Mr. Chen Zhengxu, introduces the concepts of electric energy and kilowatt-hour (kWh), including practical calculation examples.

課程簡介

高中基本電學_電學基礎理論_電功率_PART B 電能與電度，由陳政旭老師主講，主要介紹電能與電度的概念。

Key Points

  • Meaning of Electric Energy: Electric energy is the energy consumed by an electrical appliance with power P (watts) over t seconds.
    Formula: $W = P \cdot t$, unit: joule (J).
  • Kilowatt-Hour (kWh): kWh is the unit used by power companies to measure electric energy. 1 kWh = the energy consumed by a 1000-watt appliance used for 1 hour.
  • Conversion between Electric Energy and kWh: 1 kWh = $3.6 \times 10^6$ joules.

Examples

  • Example 1: How much energy (in joules) does a 4000-watt motor consume in 30 minutes?
    $W = 4000 \cdot (30 \cdot 60) = 7.2 \times 10^6$ J
  • Example 2: Calculating a household's daily electricity cost.
    Total usage: 6 kWh.
    Total cost: $6 \cdot 3 = 18$ NTD/day.
    30-day total: $18 \cdot 30 = 540$ NTD.

Vocabulary

  • Electric Energy
  • Electricity Degree or Kilowatt-Hour (kWh)
  • Electric Power

影片重點統整

  • 電能的涵義：電能是功率為P瓦特的電器用品，使用t秒鐘所消耗的能量。
    公式：$W = P \cdot t$，單位為焦耳。
  • 電度：電度是電力公司對電能的計算方式。1度電 = 1000瓦的功率的電器用品，使用1個小時所消耗的電能。
  • 電能與電度的換算：1度電 = $3.6 \times 10^6$焦耳。

範例

  • 範例一：4000瓦的電動機運轉30分鐘，共消耗電能多少焦耳？
    $W = 4000 \cdot (30 \cdot 60) = 7.2 \times 10^6$焦耳。
  • 範例二：某家庭每日用電量計算，總共要付多少電費？
    總用電量：6度電。
    總電費：$6 \cdot 3 = 18$元/天。
    30天總電費：$18 \cdot 30 = 540$元。

英文翻譯

  • 電能：Electric Energy
  • 電度：Electricity Degree or Kilowatt-Hour (kWh)
  • 電功率：Electric Power

entry.content:
Introduction

This lesson covers the concept of efficiency in electrical power, including its definition, formula, and practical examples. Understanding efficiency is crucial for analyzing energy conversion systems and optimizing performance.

前言

本課程介紹電功率中的效率概念，包括定義、公式與實際範例。理解效率對於分析能量轉換系統與提升效能至關重要。

Key Points

  • Efficiency Definition: Efficiency is defined as the ratio of output energy to input energy, expressed as a percentage.
  • Efficiency Formula: Efficiency = (Output Energy / Input Energy) × 100%
  • Energy Conversion System: An energy conversion system can consist of multiple subsystems connected in series, with the overall efficiency being the product of the efficiencies of the individual subsystems.

Example Analysis

  • Example 1: A water pump motor with an input power of 880 watts and an efficiency of 0.85, find output power and loss power.
  • Example 2: A power system consisting of two subsystems with efficiencies of 0.8 and 0.9, find the overall efficiency and output energy.

詳細重點統整

  • 效率的定義：效率是指輸出能量與輸入能量的比值，以百分率表示。
  • 效率公式：效率 = (輸出能量 / 輸入能量) × 100%
  • 能量轉換系統：能量轉換系統可以由多個子系統串接而成，總效率為各子系統效率的乘積。

範例解析

  • 範例一：抽水馬達輸入功率 880 瓦，效率 0.85，求輸出功率和損失功率。
  • 範例二：電力系統由兩個子系統組成，效率分別為 0.8 和 0.9，求總效率和輸出能量。

entry.content:
Introduction

This article demonstrates a practical example of calculating the resistance of a copper wire, showing the step-by-step process of applying the resistance formula and unit conversions.

引言

本文展示了一個計算銅線電阻的實際範例，說明如何應用電阻公式和進行單位轉換的步驟。

Key Points

  1. Problem Background:
    Example: Calculate the resistance of a copper wire that is 2 kilometers long and has a cross-sectional area of 14 square millimeters.
  2. Parameter Identification:
    Length \( L = 2000 \, \text{m} \) (converted from kilometers)
    Cross-sectional area \( A = 14 \times 10^{-6} \, \text{m}^2 \) (converted from square millimeters)
    Resistivity of copper \( \rho = 1.724 \times 10^{-8} \, \Omega \cdot \text{m} \)
  3. Resistance Formula:
    Using the formula \( R = \frac{\rho L}{A} \)
    Calculated resistance \( R = 2.463 \, \Omega \)
  4. Unit Conversion:
    Ensure all parameters are in MKS units (meters, kilograms, seconds).

重點歸納

  1. 題目背景：
    例題：計算一條長2公里、截面積14平方公釐的銅線電阻。
  2. 參數標示：
    長度 \( L = 2000 \, \text{m} \)（轉換自公里）
    截面積 \( A = 14 \times 10^{-6} \, \text{m}^2 \)（轉換自平方公釐）
    銅的電阻係數 \( \rho = 1.724 \times 10^{-8} \, \Omega \cdot \text{m} \)
  3. 電阻公式：
    使用公式 \( R = \frac{\rho L}{A} \)
    計算得出電阻 \( R = 2.463 \, \Omega \)
  4. 單位轉換：
    確保所有參數使用MKS制（米、公斤、秒）。

Introduction

This article explores the fundamental concepts of electrical resistance and resistivity, including their definitions, mathematical relationships, and practical applications in electrical engineering.

引言

本文探討電阻與電阻係數的基本概念，包括其定義、數學關係以及在電氣工程中的實際應用。

Key Points

  1. Definition of Resistance:
    Resistance is the opposition encountered by electric current flowing through a material, measured in Ohms (Ω).
  2. Factors Affecting Resistance:
    Resistivity (ρ): The resistance capability of different materials.
    Length (L): Longer lengths result in higher resistance.
    Cross-sectional Area (A): Larger areas lead to lower resistance.
  3. Mathematical Formula:
    The formula for calculating resistance is:
    $$R = \frac{\rho \cdot L}{A}$$
    Where R is resistance, ρ is resistivity, L is length, and A is cross-sectional area.
  4. Relationship Between Resistance and Conductance:
    Conductance is the reciprocal of resistance, indicating the ability to conduct electricity.
  5. Practical Applications:
    Engineers use resistors to control current in circuits, ensuring stable operation.

重點歸納

  1. 電阻的定義：
    電阻是電流在物體中流動時所遇到的阻力，單位為歐姆（Ω）。
  2. 電阻的影響因素：
    電阻係數（ρ）：不同材質的電阻能力。
    物體長度（L）：長度越長，電阻越大。
    截面積（A）：截面積越大，電阻越小。
  3. 數學公式：
    電阻的計算公式為：
    $$R = \frac{\rho \cdot L}{A}$$
    其中，R為電阻，ρ為電阻係數，L為長度，A為截面積。
  4. 電阻與電導的關係：
    電導是電阻的倒數，表示導電能力。
  5. 實際應用：
    工程師利用電阻來控制電路中的電流，確保穩定操作。

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Fundamental Theories of Electricity - Current Part B - 高中基本電學：電學基礎理論 - 電流 PART B
entry.content:
Introduction

Current is a fundamental concept in electricity that describes the flow of electric charge. This article explores an alternative method for calculating current based on the physical properties of conductors and electron movement.

引言

電流是電學中的基本概念，描述電荷的流動。本文探討基於導體物理特性和電子運動的電流計算替代方法。

Current Definition and Basic Formula

Current (I) is defined as the amount of charge (Q) passing through a conductor's cross-section per unit time (t):

I = Q/t

電流定義與基本公式

電流(I)定義為單位時間(t)內通過導體截面的電荷量(Q)：

I = Q/t

Alternative Current Calculation Method

Current can also be calculated using the following formula:

I = N × A × v × e

Where:

  • N: Number of free electrons per cubic meter
  • A: Cross-sectional area of the conductor (m²)
  • v: Velocity of electron flow (m/s)
  • e: Charge of an electron (approximately 1.6 × 10^-19 coulombs)

電流計算的替代方法

電流也可以使用以下公式計算：

I = N × A × v × e

其中：

  • N：每立方公尺的自由電子數量
  • A：導體的截面積（m²）
  • v：電子的移動速率（m/s）
  • e：電子的電荷量（約1.6 × 10^-19庫侖）

Calculation Examples

Example 1: Current Calculation in Copper Wire

Given:

  • Free electron density (N) = 8.5 × 10^28 electrons/m³
  • Cross-sectional area (A) = 1 × 10^-6 m²
  • Electron velocity (v) = 0.1 mm/s

Calculate the current:

I = N × A × v × e

I = (8.5 × 10^28) × (1 × 10^-6) × (0.1 × 10^-3) × (1.6 × 10^-19)

I = 1.36 A

Example 2: Electron Velocity Calculation

Given:

  • Current (I) = 2 A
  • Free electron density (N) = 8.5 × 10^28 electrons/m³
  • Cross-sectional area (A) = 2 × 10^-6 m²

Calculate the electron velocity:

v = I / (N × A × e)

v = 2 / [(8.5 × 10^28) × (2 × 10^-6) × (1.6 × 10^-19)]

v ≈ 0.074 mm/s

計算範例

範例1：銅線中的電流計算

已知：

  • 自由電子密度(N) = 8.5 × 10^28 電子/m³
  • 截面積(A) = 1 × 10^-6 m²
  • 電子速度(v) = 0.1 mm/s

計算電流：

I = N × A × v × e

I = (8.5 × 10^28) × (1 × 10^-6) × (0.1 × 10^-3) × (1.6 × 10^-19)

I = 1.36 A

範例2：電子速度計算

已知：

  • 電流(I) = 2 A
  • 自由電子密度(N) = 8.5 × 10^28 電子/m³
  • 截面積(A) = 2 × 10^-6 m²

計算電子速度：

v = I / (N × A × e)

v = 2 / [(8.5 × 10^28) × (2 × 10^-6) × (1.6 × 10^-19)]

v ≈ 0.074 mm/s

Summary

Understanding current calculation methods is essential for electrical engineering

Both basic and alternative formulas provide valuable insights

Proper unit conversion is crucial for accurate calculations

Physical properties of conductors affect current flow

總結

理解電流計算方法對電機工程至關重要

基本公式和替代公式都提供了寶貴的見解

正確的單位轉換對準確計算至關重要

導體的物理特性影響電流流動

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Fundamental Theories of Electricity - Charge Part A - 高中基本電學：電學基礎理論 - 電荷 PART A
entry.content:
Introduction

The study of electricity begins with understanding the fundamental concept of electric charge. This article explores the historical development of charge theory and introduces key scientific contributions that shaped our understanding of electricity.

引言

電學的研究始於理解電荷的基本概念。本文探討電荷理論的歷史發展，並介紹塑造我們對電學理解的關鍵科學貢獻。

Historical Background

The understanding of electric charge has evolved through the contributions of several important scientists:

Sir Isaac Newton (1643-1727): His work on universal gravitation influenced later theories of electrical forces

Charles-Augustin de Coulomb (1736-1806): Formulated Coulomb's law describing electrical forces

John Dalton (1766-1844): Proposed atomic theory, though later modified

Robert Millikan (1868-1953): Measured the charge of a single electron

Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937): Contributed to understanding atomic structure

歷史背景

對電荷的理解通過幾位重要科學家的貢獻而發展：

艾薩克・牛頓爵士(1643-1727)：他對萬有引力的研究影響了後來的電力理論

查爾斯・奧古斯丁・庫侖(1736-1806)：提出描述電力作用的庫侖定律

約翰・道耳吞(1766-1844)：提出原子理論，後被修正

羅伯特・密利根(1868-1953)：測量單一電子的電荷

歐內斯特・拉塞福(1871-1937)：對理解原子結構做出貢獻

Basic Charge and Electric Quantity

The fundamental unit of electric charge is the coulomb (C)

One electron carries a charge of -1.6 × 10^-19 coulombs

One proton carries a charge of +1.6 × 10^-19 coulombs

The charge of an electron is equal in magnitude but opposite in sign to that of a proton

基本電荷與電量

電量的基本單位是庫侖(C)

一個電子帶有-1.6 × 10^-19庫侖的電量

一個質子帶有+1.6 × 10^-19庫侖的電量

電子的電量與質子大小相等但符號相反

Key Scientific Contributions

Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation

Influenced the development of Coulomb's law

Demonstrated the concept of action at a distance

Established mathematical relationships for forces

Coulomb's Law

Describes the force between two point charges

Like charges repel, unlike charges attract

Force is proportional to the product of charges

Force is inversely proportional to the square of distance

Dalton's Atomic Theory

Atoms are indivisible (later revised)

All atoms of an element are identical

Atoms combine in simple whole number ratios

Millikan's Oil Drop Experiment

Measured the charge of a single electron

Determined the basic charge unit

Confirmed the quantization of electric charge

關鍵科學貢獻

牛頓的萬有引力定律

影響了庫侖定律的發展

展示了超距作用的概念

建立了力的數學關係

庫侖定律

描述兩個點電荷之間的力

同性相斥，異性相吸

力與電荷乘積成正比

力與距離平方成反比

道耳吞的原子理論

原子是不可分割的（後被修正）

同一元素的所有原子都相同

原子以簡單整數比結合

密利根的油滴實驗

測量單一電子的電荷

確定了基本電荷單位

證實了電荷的量子化

Charge Calculations

Example 1: Total Charge Calculation

Calculate the total charge of 5 × 10^19 electrons:

Q = 5 × 10^19 × (-1.6 × 10^-19)

Q = -8 coulombs

The negative sign indicates excess electrons

Example 2: Number of Electrons

Calculate the number of electrons in 1 coulomb:

Number of electrons = 1 / (1.6 × 10^-19)

Number of electrons = 6.25 × 10^18

電荷計算

範例1：總電量計算

計算5 × 10^19個電子的總電量：

Q = 5 × 10^19 × (-1.6 × 10^-19)

Q = -8庫侖

負號表示過量的電子

範例2：電子數量

計算1庫侖中的電子數量：

電子數量 = 1 / (1.6 × 10^-19)

電子數量 = 6.25 × 10^18

Summary

Electric charge is a fundamental property of matter

The basic unit of charge is the coulomb

Charges interact through Coulomb's law

Understanding charge is essential for electricity

Historical experiments shaped our understanding

總結

電荷是物質的基本屬性

電量的基本單位是庫侖

電荷通過庫侖定律相互作用

理解電荷對電學至關重要

歷史實驗塑造了我們的理解

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Characteristics of Static Charge and Example Exercises - 高中基本電學：靜電荷的特性與範例練習
entry.content:
Introduction

Static charge is a fundamental concept in electricity that helps us understand the behavior of electric charges at rest. This article explores the basic characteristics of static charge, including the concepts of electrons and coulombs, and provides practical examples to enhance understanding.

引言

靜電荷是電學中的基本概念，幫助我們理解靜止狀態下電荷的行為。本文將探討靜電荷的基本特性，包括電子和庫侖的概念，並提供實際範例以加深理解。

Basic Unit of Electric Charge

The fundamental unit of electric charge is the coulomb (C)

One electron carries a charge of -1.6 × 10^-19 coulombs

One proton carries a charge of +1.6 × 10^-19 coulombs

The charge of an electron is equal in magnitude but opposite in sign to that of a proton

電量的基本單位

電量的基本單位是庫侖(C)

一個電子帶有-1.6 × 10^-19庫侖的電量

一個質子帶有+1.6 × 10^-19庫侖的電量

電子的電量與質子大小相等但符號相反

Definition of Static Charge

Static charge refers to electric charge that is at rest

It is the accumulation of electric charge on the surface of an object

Static charge can be generated through friction, contact, or induction

The charge remains stationary until it is discharged or neutralized

靜電荷的定義

靜電荷指的是靜止不動的電荷

它是物體表面電荷的累積

靜電荷可以通過摩擦、接觸或感應產生

電荷保持靜止直到被放電或中和

Characteristics of Static Charge

Like Charges Repel

Charges of the same type repel each other

Positive charges repel other positive charges

Negative charges repel other negative charges

This is a fundamental property of electric charges

Opposite Charges Attract

Charges of different types attract each other

Positive and negative charges are attracted to each other

This attraction is the basis of many electrical phenomena

The force of attraction increases with decreasing distance

Electrostatic Induction

Neutral objects can be affected by nearby charged objects

Charges in the neutral object redistribute themselves

This creates temporary charge separation

The effect is stronger at closer distances

靜電荷的特性

同性相斥

相同類型的電荷互相排斥

正電荷排斥其他正電荷

負電荷排斥其他負電荷

這是電荷的基本特性

異性相吸

不同類型的電荷互相吸引

正電荷和負電荷互相吸引

這種吸引力是許多電學現象的基礎

吸引力隨距離減少而增加

靜電感應

中性物體會受到附近帶電物體的影響

中性物體中的電荷會重新分布

這會產生暫時的電荷分離

距離越近，效果越強

Franklin's Experiment

Benjamin Franklin conducted experiments with static electricity

He rubbed a glass rod with silk to generate static charge

The glass rod became positively charged

The silk became negatively charged

This experiment demonstrated the transfer of electrons

富蘭克林的實驗

班傑明・富蘭克林進行了靜電實驗

他通過摩擦玻璃棒和絲綢產生靜電

玻璃棒帶正電

絲綢帶負電

這個實驗展示了電子的轉移

Example Exercises

Example 1: Calculating Atomic Charge

Calculate the electric charge of an atom with 6 electrons and 3 protons:

Q = -6 × 1.6 × 10^-19 + 3 × 1.6 × 10^-19

Q = -4.8 × 10^-19 C

The atom has a net negative charge

Example 2: Charge Removal

Calculate the final charge after removing -1.5 microcoulombs:

Initial charge = -1.5 × 10^-6 C

Removed charge = -1.5 × 10^-6 C

Final charge = 0 C (neutral)

範例練習

範例1：計算原子電量

計算帶有6個電子和3個質子的原子電量：

Q = -6 × 1.6 × 10^-19 + 3 × 1.6 × 10^-19

Q = -4.8 × 10^-19 C

該原子帶有淨負電荷

範例2：電荷移除

計算移去-1.5微庫侖電荷後的帶電量：

初始電量 = -1.5 × 10^-6 C

移除電量 = -1.5 × 10^-6 C

最終電量 = 0 C（中性）

Summary

Static charge is electric charge at rest

Like charges repel, opposite charges attract

Electrostatic induction affects neutral objects

Charge can be calculated using the number of electrons and protons

Understanding static charge is fundamental to electricity

總結

靜電荷是靜止的電荷

同性相斥，異性相吸

靜電感應影響中性物體

電量可以通過電子和質子數量計算

理解靜電荷是電學的基礎

entry.title: High School Basic Electricity: Current Direction and Magnitude - 高中基本電學：電流的方向與大小
entry.content:
Introduction

Understanding current direction and magnitude is fundamental to electrical engineering. This article explores the basic concepts of current flow, its direction, and how to calculate its magnitude in practical applications. We will cover both theoretical concepts and practical examples to help you better understand current in electrical circuits.

引言

理解電流的方向和大小是電機工程的基本要素。本文將探討電流流動的基本概念、方向以及如何在實際應用中計算其大小。我們將涵蓋理論概念和實際範例，幫助您更好地理解電路中的電流。

Definition of Current

Current is defined as the rate of flow of electric charge. It represents the amount of charge passing through a conductor's cross-section per unit time. This fundamental concept is essential for understanding how electricity works in circuits.

Current is measured in amperes (A)

One ampere equals one coulomb per second

Current can be either direct (DC) or alternating (AC)

電流的定義

電流被定義為電荷流動的速率。它代表單位時間內通過導體截面的電荷量。這個基本概念對於理解電路中電的工作原理至關重要。

電流以安培(A)為單位

一安培等於每秒一庫侖

電流可以是直流(DC)或交流(AC)

Direction of Current

Conventional Current

Conventional current flows from positive to negative terminal

This concept originated from Benjamin Franklin's hypothesis in the 18th century

The conventional current direction is still used in circuit analysis and schematics

This direction is opposite to the actual electron flow

Electron Flow

In reality, electrons flow from negative to positive terminal

Electron flow represents the actual movement of charge carriers

Understanding both concepts is crucial for circuit analysis

Electron flow is important for understanding semiconductor behavior

電流的方向

傳統電流

傳統電流從正極流向負極

這個概念源自18世紀班傑明・富蘭克林的假設

傳統電流方向仍用於電路分析和電路圖

這個方向與實際的電子流動方向相反

電子流動

實際上，電子從負極流向正極

電子流動代表電荷載子的實際運動

理解這兩個概念對電路分析至關重要

電子流動對於理解半導體行為很重要

Magnitude of Current

Basic Formula

The magnitude of current is calculated using the formula:

I = Q/t

Where:

I = Current in amperes (A)

Q = Charge in coulombs (C)

t = Time in seconds (s)

Important Relationships

Current is directly proportional to charge (I ∝ Q)

Current is inversely proportional to time (I ∝ 1/t)

Current can be measured using an ammeter

Current is a fundamental quantity in electrical circuits

電流的大小

基本公式

電流的大小使用以下公式計算：

I = Q/t

其中：

I = 電流，單位為安培(A)

Q = 電荷量，單位為庫侖(C)

t = 時間，單位為秒(s)

重要關係

電流與電荷量成正比 (I ∝ Q)

電流與時間成反比 (I ∝ 1/t)

電流可以用電流表測量

電流是電路中的基本量

Practical Examples

Example 1: Calculating Average Current

If 3000 coulombs of charge flow through a conductor in 5 minutes:

Time = 5 minutes = 300 seconds

Charge = 3000 coulombs

Current = 3000/300 = 10 amperes

This represents a relatively high current flow

Example 2: Battery Charging Time

For a 1750mAh battery charged at 1 ampere:

Battery capacity = 1750mAh = 1.75Ah

Charging current = 1A

Charging time = 1.75 hours

This is a typical charging scenario for mobile devices

Example 3: Household Circuit

In a typical household circuit:

Standard voltage = 110V or 220V (depending on region)

Typical current = 15-20 amperes

Power = Voltage × Current

This current rating is for safety and practical usage

實際範例

範例1：計算平均電流

如果在5分鐘內有3000庫侖的電量流過導體：

時間 = 5分鐘 = 300秒

電荷量 = 3000庫侖

電流 = 3000/300 = 10安培

這代表一個相對較高的電流

範例2：電池充電時間

對於1750mAh的電池以1安培充電：

電池容量 = 1750mAh = 1.75Ah

充電電流 = 1A

充電時間 = 1.75小時

這是移動設備的典型充電情況

範例3：家用電路

在典型的家用電路中：

標準電壓 = 110V或220V（依地區而定）

典型電流 = 15-20安培

功率 = 電壓 × 電流

這個電流額定值是基於安全和實際使用考慮

Summary

Current is the flow of electric charge through a conductor

Conventional current flows from positive to negative

Electron flow is in the opposite direction

Current magnitude is calculated using I = Q/t

Understanding current is essential for circuit analysis

總結

電流是電荷在導體中的流動

傳統電流從正極流向負極

電子流動方向與之相反

電流大小使用I = Q/t計算

理解電流對電路分析至關重要

entry.content:
Introduction

Voltage is one of the fundamental concepts in electricity, playing a crucial role in understanding how electrical circuits work. This article will explain voltage through everyday examples and analogies, making it easier to grasp this important concept.

引言

電壓是電學中的基本概念之一，對於理解電路運作起著至關重要的作用。本文將通過日常生活中的例子和類比來解釋電壓，使這個重要概念更容易理解。

What is Voltage?

Voltage can be understood through a simple water analogy:

  • Just as water flows from high to low levels, electricity flows from high to low voltage
  • Water pressure pushes water through pipes, voltage pushes electrons through wires
  • The greater the height difference, the stronger the water flow; similarly, the greater the voltage difference, the stronger the current

什麼是電壓？

電壓可以通過簡單的水流類比來理解：

  • 就像水從高處流向低處，電流從高電壓流向低電壓
  • 水壓推動水通過管道，電壓推動電子通過導線
  • 高度差越大，水流越強；同樣，電壓差越大，電流越強

Definition of Voltage

Voltage is defined as the energy required to move electric charges in a circuit. It is measured in volts (V) and represents the potential energy difference between two points in an electrical circuit.

電壓的定義

電壓被定義為在電路中移動電荷所需的能量。它以伏特(V)為單位，代表電路中兩點之間的電位能差。

Types of Voltage

  • Electric Potential: The potential energy at a specific point in an electric field
  • Potential Difference: The difference in electric potential between two points
  • Electromotive Force (EMF): The energy provided by a power source to move charges
  • Voltage Drop: The decrease in voltage across a component in a circuit

電壓的類型

  • 電位：電場中特定點的電位能
  • 電位差：兩點之間的電位差異
  • 電動勢：電源提供的移動電荷的能量
  • 電壓降：電路中元件兩端的電壓降低

Key Concepts

Voltage and Current Flow

Voltage is the driving force behind current flow, similar to how water pressure drives water flow. The relationship can be expressed as:

VAB = VA - VB

For example, if point A has a potential of 100V and point B has 60V:

VAB = 100V - 60V = 40V

重要概念

電壓與電流流動

電壓是推動電流流動的力量，類似於水壓推動水流動。其關係可以表示為：

VAB = VA - VB

例如，如果A點電位為100V，B點電位為60V：

VAB = 100V - 60V = 40V

Unit of Voltage

The volt (V) is the SI unit of voltage, named after Alessandro Volta, who invented the first chemical battery. One volt is defined as the potential difference that will drive one ampere of current through one ohm of resistance.

電壓的單位

伏特(V)是電壓的國際單位，以發明第一個化學電池的亞歷山大·伏特命名。一伏特被定義為能夠驅動一安培電流通過一歐姆電阻的電位差。

entry.title: Electrical Units and International System
entry.content:
Importance of Numbers and Units

English:

  • A number combined with a unit is the universal language in science, providing objective meaning.
  • For example, height and weight need units for expression.
  • Without units, numbers lose their context and significance.

繁體中文:

  • 數字加上單位是科學界的共通語言，能提供客觀的意義。
  • 例如：身高、體重等都需要單位來表達。
  • 沒有單位，數字就失去了上下文和意義。

International System of Units (SI)

English:

Base Units:

  • Length: Meter (m)
  • Mass: Kilogram (kg)
  • Time: Second (s)
  • Electric current: Ampere (A)
  • Thermodynamic temperature: Kelvin (K)
  • Amount of substance: Mole (mol)
  • Luminous intensity: Candela (cd)

Derived Units:

  • Speed: Meters per second (m/s)
  • Density: Kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m³)
  • Force: Newton (N) = kg·m/s²
  • Energy: Joule (J) = N·m = kg·m²/s²

繁體中文:

基本單位：

  • 長度：公尺 (m)
  • 質量：公斤 (kg)
  • 時間：秒 (s)
  • 電流：安培 (A)
  • 熱力學溫度：克耳文 (K)
  • 物質的量：莫耳 (mol)
  • 發光強度：燭光 (cd)

導出單位：

  • 速度：米每秒 (m/s)
  • 密度：公斤每立方公尺 (kg/m³)
  • 力：牛頓 (N) = kg·m/s²
  • 能量：焦耳 (J) = N·m = kg·m²/s²

Common Electrical Units

English:

QuantitySymbolUnitSymbolDefinition
ChargeQCoulombCA·s
CurrentIAmpereAC/s
VoltageVVoltVJ/C = W/A
ResistanceROhmΩV/A
PowerPWattWJ/s = V·A
EnergyEJouleJW·s = N·m
CapacitanceCFaradFC/V
InductanceLHenryHV·s/A

繁體中文:

物理量符號單位符號定義
電荷Q庫倫CA·s
電流I安培AC/s
電壓V伏特VJ/C = W/A
電阻R歐姆ΩV/A
電功率P瓦特WJ/s = V·A
電能E焦耳JW·s = N·m
電容C法拉FC/V
電感L亨利HV·s/A

Writing Conventions

English:

  • Use italics for symbols and upright font for units.
  • Example: “The current I = 5 A flows through a resistor of resistance R = 10 Ω.”
  • Leave a space between the number and the unit.
  • Units derived from proper names are capitalized (e.g., Ampere → A), but written in lowercase when spelled out (e.g., ampere).

繁體中文:

  • 符號使用斜體，單位使用正體。
  • 例如：「電流 I = 5 A 流過電阻為 R = 10 Ω 的電阻器。」
  • 數字和單位之間要留有空格。
  • 由人名衍生的單位符號要大寫（例如：安培 → A），但拼寫出來時用小寫（例如：ampere）。

Importance in Electrical Engineering

English:

  • Standardized units allow engineers worldwide to communicate effectively.
  • Prevents costly errors in design and implementation.
  • Enables accurate measurements and comparisons in experiments.
  • Forms the foundation for all electrical calculations and formulas.

繁體中文:

  • 標準化的單位使全球工程師能有效溝通。
  • 防止設計和實施過程中的昂貴錯誤。
  • 使實驗中的測量和比較更加準確。
  • 為所有電學計算和公式奠定基礎。

entry.title: Understanding Prefixes for Powers of Ten
entry.content:
Understanding Prefixes for Powers of Ten

Definition

Power of Ten: Represented as \(10^n\), used to simplify numerical representation.

定義

十的冪次方：表示為 \(10^n\)，用於簡化數字表示。

Prefixes and Their Meanings

Prefix Symbol Power Example
Tera T \(10^{12}\) 1 TΩ = \(1 \times 10^{12}\) Ω
Giga G \(10^{9}\) 1 GΩ = \(1 \times 10^{9}\) Ω
Mega M \(10^{6}\) 1 MΩ = \(1 \times 10^{6}\) Ω
Kilo k \(10^{3}\) 1 kΩ = \(1 \times 10^{3}\) Ω
Milli m \(10^{-3}\) 1 mA = \(1 \times 10^{-3}\) A
Micro μ \(10^{-6}\) 1 μF = \(1 \times 10^{-6}\) F
Nano n \(10^{-9}\) 1 nF = \(1 \times 10^{-9}\) F
Pico p \(10^{-12}\) 1 pF = \(1 \times 10^{-12}\) F

字首及其含義

字首 符號 冪次方 例子
兆 T \(10^{12}\) 1 TΩ = \(1 \times 10^{12}\) Ω
十億 G \(10^{9}\) 1 GΩ = \(1 \times 10^{9}\) Ω
百萬 M \(10^{6}\) 1 MΩ = \(1 \times 10^{6}\) Ω
千 k \(10^{3}\) 1 kΩ = \(1 \times 10^{3}\) Ω
毫 m \(10^{-3}\) 1 mA = \(1 \times 10^{-3}\) A
微 μ \(10^{-6}\) 1 μF = \(1 \times 10^{-6}\) F
奈 n \(10^{-9}\) 1 nF = \(1 \times 10^{-9}\) F
皮 p \(10^{-12}\) 1 pF = \(1 \times 10^{-12}\) F

*注意: 台灣對 p ($10^{-12}$) 的翻譯通常為「皮」，而非「漠」

Application

  • Simplifies numerical writing, avoiding errors.
  • Commonly used by engineers and scientists for calculations and communication.

應用

  • 簡化數字書寫，避免錯誤。
  • 工程師和科學家常用於計算和溝通。

Computer Terminology

In computing, the definitions of prefixes differ (based on powers of 2):

  • K (Kilo) = \(2^{10}\) = 1024
  • M (Mega) = \(2^{20}\) = 1,048,576
  • G (Giga) = \(2^{30}\) = 1,073,741,824

電腦術語

在電腦中，字首的定義不同 (基於2的冪次方)：

  • K（千） = \(2^{10}\) = 1024
  • M（百萬） = \(2^{20}\) = 1,048,576
  • G（十億） = \(2^{30}\) = 1,073,741,824

Examples

  • Resistor: 47 kΩ = \(47 \times 10^{3}\) Ω
  • Current: 0.005 A = 5 mA = \(5 \times 10^{-3}\) A

例子

  • 電阻：47 kΩ = \(47 \times 10^{3}\) Ω
  • 電流：0.005 A = 5 mA = \(5 \times 10^{-3}\) A
